item.title: Evolution of welfare policies in the OECD: An interactive web-based mapping exercise using R and Plotly
item.description: Introduction JobSeeker and JobKeeper benefits have been at the forefront of the national debate on government assistance in the post-Covid Australian economic landscape. Yet even before the global pandemic hit, welfare benefits were a controversial and often polarizing issue in Australia. Often missing from the national debate though is a discussion around how welfare benefits paid by the Australian government compare with those from other “welfare states” like Norway, France, and the UK.

item.title: Build a Twitter dataset using TAGS
item.description: This tutorial looks at how to extract data from Twitter with tools that don’t require prior programming experience.

item.title: Making a Covid-19 map in R using Shiny and Leaflet
item.description: Introduction There have been a number of interactive Covid-19 maps released since the beginning of the pandemic. Johns Hopkins University was among the first of many institutions to create an interactive visualization illustrating the transmission dynamics of the coronavirus. In this tutorial, we will go combine a number of packages in R to create a similar interactive transmission map. Required packages and data No previous coding experience is necessary to follow along with this tutorial.

item.title: Collect Twitter data using `rtweet`
item.description: Introduction This tutorial demonstrates how to collect, filter and plot tweets using the R rtweet package. Data and libraries The rtweet package has been designed by Michael W. Kearney to collect and organise Twitter data using Twitter’s Application Program Interfaces (API). Further details about the package can be found at: rtweet Github repository Michael Kearney’s Introduction to rtweet Michael Kearney’s slides on ‘Collecting and Analyzing Twitter Data’
